   20: -module(init_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([get_arguments/1, get_argument/1, boot_var/1, restart/1,
   29: 	 many_restarts/0, many_restarts/1, restart_with_mode/1,
   30: 	 get_plain_arguments/1, init_group_history_deadlock/1,
   31: 	 reboot/1, stop_status/1, stop/1, get_status/1, script_id/1,
   32:          dot_erlang/1, unknown_module/1, dash_S/1, dash_extra/1,
   33:          dash_run/1, dash_s/1,
   34: 	 find_system_processes/0
   35:          ]).
   36: -export([boot1/1, boot2/1]).
   37: -export([test_dash_S/1, test_dash_s/1, test_dash_extra/0,
   38:          test_dash_run/0, test_dash_run/1]).
   39: 
   40: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   41: 
   42: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   43: %% Test suite for init. (Most code is run during system start/stop.
   44: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
   45: %% erl -sname master -rsh ctrsh
   46: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [get_arguments, get_argument, boot_var,
   53:      many_restarts, restart_with_mode,
   54:      get_plain_arguments, init_group_history_deadlock,
   55:      restart, stop_status, get_status, script_id,
   56:      dot_erlang, unknown_module, {group, boot},
   57:      dash_S, dash_extra, dash_run, dash_s].
   58: 
   59: groups() -> 
   60:     [{boot, [], [boot1, boot2]}].
   61: 
   62: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   66:     ok.
   67: 
   68: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: 
   75: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: get_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   82:     Args = args(),
   83:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
   84:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_arguments, []) of
   85: 	Arguments when is_list(Arguments) ->
   86: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
   87: 	    check_a(Arguments),
   88: 	    check_b(Arguments),
   89: 	    check_c(Arguments),
   90: 	    check_d(Arguments);
   91: 	_ ->
   92:             peer:stop(Peer),
   93: 	    ct:fail(get_arguments)
   94:     end,
   95:     ok.
   96: 
   97: check_a(Args) ->
   98:     case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args) of
   99: 	{value, {a,["kalle"]}} ->
  100: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(a,1,Args),
  101: 	    case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args1) of
  102: 		false ->
  103: 		    ok;
  104: 		_ ->
  105: 		    ct:fail(check_a1)
  106: 	    end;
  107: 	_ ->
  108: 	    ct:fail(check_a2)
  109:     end.
  110: 
  111: check_b(Args) ->
  112:     case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args) of
  113: 	{value, {b,["hej", "hopp"]}} ->
  114: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args),
  115: 	    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args1) of
  116: 		{value, {b,["san", "sa"]}} ->
  117: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args1),
  118: 		    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args2) of
  119: 			false ->
  120: 			    ok;
  121: 			_ ->
  122: 			    ct:fail(check_b1)
  123: 		    end;
  124: 		_ ->
  125: 		    ct:fail(check_b2)
  126: 	    end;
  127: 	_ ->
  128: 	    ct:fail(check_b3)
  129:     end.
  130: 
  131: check_c(Args) ->
  132:     case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args) of
  133: 	{value, {c,["4", "5", "6"]}} ->
  134: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args),
  135: 	    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args1) of
  136: 		{value, {c,["7", "8", "9"]}} ->
  137: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args1),
  138: 		    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args2) of
  139: 			false ->
  140: 			    ok;
  141: 			_ ->
  142: 			    ct:fail(check_c1)
  143: 		    end;
  144: 		_ ->
  145: 		    ct:fail(check_c2)
  146: 	    end;
  147: 	_ ->
  148: 	    ct:fail(check_c3)
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: check_d(Args) ->
  152:     case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args) of
  153: 	{value, {d,[]}} ->
  154: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(d,1,Args),
  155: 	    case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args1) of
  156: 		false ->
  157: 		    ok;
  158: 		_ ->
  159: 		    ct:fail(check_d1)
  160: 	    end;
  161: 	_ ->
  162: 	    ct:fail(check_d2)
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: get_argument(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     Args = args(),
  167:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  168:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [b]) of
  169: 	{ok, [["hej", "hopp"],["san", "sa"]]} ->
  170: 	    ok;
  171: 	_ ->
  172: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  173: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, b})
  174:     end,
  175:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [a]) of
  176: 	{ok, [["kalle"]]} ->
  177: 	    ok;
  178: 	_ ->
  179: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  180: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, a})
  181:     end,
  182:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  183: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  184: 	    ok;
  185: 	_ ->
  186: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  187: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, c})
  188:     end,
  189:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [d]) of
  190: 	{ok, [[]]} ->
  191: 	    ok;
  192: 	_ ->
  193: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  194: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, d})
  195:     end,
  196:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [e]) of
  197: 	error ->
  198: 	    ok;
  199: 	_ ->
  200: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  201: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, e})
  202:     end,
  203:     peer:stop(Peer),
  204:     ok.
  205: 
  206: get_plain_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  207:     Longstring = 
  208: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  209: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  210: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  211: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  212: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  213: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  214: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  215: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  216: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2",
  217:     true = (length(Longstring) > 255),
  218:     Args = long_args(Longstring),
  219:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  220:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_plain_arguments, []) of
  221: 	["a", "b", "c", Longstring] ->
  222: 	    ok;
  223: 	As ->
  224: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  225: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, As})
  226:     end,
  227:     peer:stop(Peer),
  228: 
  229:     ok.
  230: 
  231: 
  232: init_group_history_deadlock(_Config) ->
  233:     Output = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -noshell -eval \"logger:warning(\\\"testing\\\")\" "
  234:             "-inets services crashme -eval \"application:start(inets, permanent).\" "),
  235: 
  236:     io:format("Got output: ~ts~n",[Output]),
  237: 
  238:     case string:find(Output, "removed_failing_handler") of
  239:         nomatch -> ok;
  240:         _ -> ct:fail("Found unexpected printout in log")
  241:     end.
  242: 
  243: %% ------------------------------------------------
  244: %% Use -boot_var flag to set $TEST_VAR in boot script.
  245: %% ------------------------------------------------
  246: boot_var(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  247:     {BootScript, TEST_VAR, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} = create_boot(Config),
  248: 
  249:     %% Should fail as we have not given -boot_var TEST_VAR
  250:     try
  251:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-boot", BootScript], connection => standard_io}),
  252:         ct:fail({boot_var, "Should not start without TEST_VAR"})
  253:     catch
  254:         exit:{boot_failed,{exit_status,1}} ->
  255:             ok
  256:     end,
  257: 
  258: 
  259:     case is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) of
  260: 	true ->
  261: 	    %% Now it should work !!
  262: 	    {ok, Peer, _} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootScript, "-boot_var", "TEST_VAR", TEST_VAR]),
  263: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  264: 	    Res = ok;
  265: 	_ ->
  266: 	    %% What we need is not so much version numbers on the directories, but
  267: 	    %% for the boot var TEST_VAR to appear in the boot script, and it doesn't
  268: 	    %% if we give the 'local' option to systools:make_script.
  269: 	    io:format(
  270: 	      "Test case not complete as we are not~n"
  271: 	      "running in a real system!~n"
  272: 	      "Probably this test is performed in a "
  273: 	      "clearcase view or source tree.~n"
  274: 	      "Need version numbers on the kernel and "
  275: 	      "stdlib directories!~n",
  276: 	      []),
  277: 	    Res = {skip,
  278: 		   "Test case only partially run since it is run "
  279: 		   "in a clearcase view or in a source tree. "
  280: 		   "Need an installed system to complete this test."}
  281:     end,
  282:     Res.
  283: 
  284: create_boot(Config) ->
  285:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  286:     {LatestDir, LatestName, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} =
  287: 	create_script(Config),
  288:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  289:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
  290:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName,
  291: 			      [{variables, [{"TEST_VAR", LibDir}]}]),
  292:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
  293:     {LatestDir ++ "/" ++ LatestName, LibDir, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn}.
  294: 
  295: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
  296:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  297:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "kernel-"++KernelVsn)) andalso
  298: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "stdlib-"++StdlibVsn)).
  299: 
  300: %% ------------------------------------------------
  301: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  302: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  303: %% before restart.
  304: %% ------------------------------------------------
  305: many_restarts() ->
  306:     [{timetrap,{minutes,16}}].
  307: 
  308: many_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  309:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io}),
  310:     loop_restart(50,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])),
  311:     peer:stop(Peer),
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: loop_restart(0,_,_,_) ->
  315:     ok;
  316: loop_restart(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  317:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  318:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  319:     receive
  320: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  321: 	    ok
  322:     after 10000 ->
  323: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  324: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  325:     end,
  326:     ok = wait_for(60, Peer, Node, EHPid),
  327:     loop_restart(N-1,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])).
  328: 
  329: wait_for(0,Peer,_Node,_) ->
  330:     peer:stop(Peer),
  331:     error;
  332: wait_for(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  333:     case rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [logger]) of
  334: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid), Pid =/= EHPid ->
  335: 	    %% erlang:display(ok),
  336: 	    ok;
  337: 	_X ->
  338: 	    %% erlang:display(_X),
  339: 	    %% Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  340: 	    %% erlang:display(Procs),
  341: 	    %% case is_list(Procs) of
  342: 	    %%     true ->
  343: 	    %% 	  [(catch erlang:display(
  344: 	    %% 			  rpc:call(Node,
  345: 	    %% 				   erlang,
  346: 	    %% 				   process_info,
  347: 	    %% 				   [Y,registered_name])))
  348: 	    %% 		 || Y <- Procs];
  349: 	    %%     _ ->
  350: 	    %% 	  ok
  351: 	    %% end,
  352: 	    receive
  353: 	    after 100 ->
  354: 		    ok
  355: 	    end,
  356: 	    wait_for(N-1,Peer,Node,EHPid)
  357:     end.
  358: 
  359: restart_with_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  360:     %% We cannot use loose_node because it doesn't run in
  361:     %% embedded mode so we quickly start one that exits after restarting
  362:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  363: 
  364:     Quote = case os:type() of
  365:                 {win32,_} ->
  366:                     [$"];
  367:                 {unix,_} ->
  368:                     [$']
  369:             end,
  370: 
  371:     Eval1 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of interactive -> init:restart([{mode,embedded}]); embedded -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  372:     Cmd1 = Erl ++ " -mode interactive -noshell -eval " ++ Eval1,
  373:     "interactiveembedded" = os:cmd(Cmd1),
  374: 
  375:     Eval2 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of embedded -> init:restart([{mode,interactive}]); interactive -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  376:     Cmd2 = Erl ++ " -mode embedded -noshell -eval " ++ Eval2,
  377:     "embeddedinteractive" = os:cmd(Cmd2),
  378: 
  379:     ok.
  380: 
  381: %% ------------------------------------------------
  382: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  383: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  384: %% before restart.
  385: %% ------------------------------------------------
  386: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  387:     Args = args(),
  388:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args, connection => standard_io}),
  389:     %% Ok, the node is up, now the real test test begins.
  390:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  391:     SysProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  392:     io:format("SysProcs0=~p~n", [SysProcs0]),
  393:     [InitPid, PurgerPid, LitCollectorPid,
  394:      DirtySigNPid, DirtySigHPid, DirtySigMPid,
  395:      PrimFilePid,
  396:      TraceCleanerPid,
  397:      ESockRegPid] = SysProcs0,
  398:     InitPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  399:     PurgerPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  400:     Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  401:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  402:     MaxPid = lists:last(Procs),
  403:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  404:     receive
  405: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  406: 	    ok
  407:     after 10000 ->
  408: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  409: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  410:     end,
  411:     ok = wait_restart(30, Node),
  412: 
  413:     SysProcs1 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  414:     io:format("SysProcs1=~p~n", [SysProcs1]),
  415:     [InitPid1, PurgerPid1, LitCollectorPid1,
  416:      DirtySigNPid1, DirtySigHPid1, DirtySigMPid1,
  417:      PrimFilePid1,
  418:      TraceCleanerPid1,
  419:      ESockRegPid1] = SysProcs1,
  420: 
  421:     %% Still the same init process!
  422:     InitPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  423:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid),
  424:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid1),
  425: 
  426:     %% and same purger process!
  427:     PurgerPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  428:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid),
  429:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid1),
  430: 
  431:     %% and same literal area collector process!
  432:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid),
  433:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid1),
  434: 
  435:     %% and same normal dirty signal handler process!
  436:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid),
  437:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid1),
  438:     %% and same high dirty signal handler process!
  439:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid),
  440:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid1),
  441:     %% and same max dirty signal handler process!
  442:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid),
  443:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid1),
  444: 
  445:     %% and same prim_file helper process!
  446:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid),
  447:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid1),
  448: 
  449:     %% and same trace_cleaner process!
  450:     TraceCleanerP = pid_to_list(TraceCleanerPid),
  451:     TraceCleanerP = pid_to_list(TraceCleanerPid1),
  452: 
  453:     %% and same socket_registry helper process!
  454:     if ESockRegPid =:= undefined, ESockRegPid1 =:= undefined ->
  455:             %% No socket registry on either node
  456:             ok;
  457:        true ->
  458:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid),
  459:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid1)
  460:     end,
  461: 
  462:     NewProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  463:     NewProcs = NewProcs0 -- SysProcs1,
  464:     case check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) of
  465: 	true ->
  466: 	    ok;
  467: 	_ ->
  468: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  469: 	    ct:fail(processes_not_greater)
  470:     end,
  471: 
  472:     %% Check that socket tables has been re-initialized; check one
  473:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  474: 
  475:     %% Test that, for instance, the same argument still exists.
  476:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  477: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  478: 	    ok;
  479: 	_ ->
  480: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  481: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, restart_fail})
  482:     end,
  483:     peer:stop(Peer),
  484:     ok.
  485: 
  486: -record(sys_procs, {init,
  487: 		    code_purger,
  488: 		    literal_collector,
  489: 		    dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  490: 		    dirty_sig_handler_high,
  491: 		    dirty_sig_handler_max,
  492:                     prim_file,
  493:                     trace_cleaner,
  494:                     socket_registry}).
  495: 
  496: find_system_processes() ->
  497:     find_system_procs(processes(), #sys_procs{}).
  498: 
  499: find_system_procs([], SysProcs) ->
  500:     [SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  501:      SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  502:      SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  503:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  504:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  505:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  506:      SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  507:      SysProcs#sys_procs.trace_cleaner,
  508:      SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry];
  509: find_system_procs([P|Ps], SysProcs) ->
  510:     case process_info(P, [initial_call, priority]) of
  511: 	[{initial_call,{erl_init,start,2}},_] ->
  512: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  513: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{init = P});
  514: 	[{initial_call,{erts_code_purger,start,0}},_] ->
  515: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  516: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{code_purger = P});
  517: 	[{initial_call,{erts_literal_area_collector,start,0}},_] ->
  518: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  519: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{literal_collector = P});
  520: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  521:          {priority,normal}] ->
  522: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  523: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_normal = P});
  524: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  525:                        {priority,high}] ->
  526: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  527: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_high = P});
  528: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  529:          {priority,max}] ->
  530: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  531: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_max = P});
  532:         [{initial_call,{prim_file,start,0}},_] ->
  533: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  534: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{prim_file = P});
  535:         [{initial_call,{erts_trace_cleaner,start,0}}, _] ->
  536: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.trace_cleaner,
  537: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{trace_cleaner = P});
  538:         [{initial_call,{socket_registry,start,0}},_] ->
  539: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry,
  540: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{socket_registry = P});
  541: 	_ ->
  542: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs)
  543:     end.
  544: 
  545: wait_restart(0, _Node) ->
  546:     ct:fail(not_restarted);
  547: wait_restart(N, Node) ->
  548:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  549: 	pong -> ok;
  550: 	_ -> 
  551: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
  552: 	    wait_restart(N - 1, Node)
  553:     end.
  554: 
  555: check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) ->
  556:     [N,P,I] = apid(MaxPid),
  557:     case lists:filter(fun(Pid) ->
  558: 			      case apid(Pid) of
  559: 				  [N,P1,_I1] when P1 > P -> false;
  560: 				  [N,_P1,I1] when I1 > I -> false;
  561: 				  _                      -> true
  562: 			      end
  563: 		      end, NewProcs) of
  564: 	[] ->
  565: 	    true;
  566: 	_  ->
  567: 	    false
  568:     end.
  569: 
  570: apid(Pid) ->
  571:     [N,P,I] = string:tokens(pid_to_list(Pid),"<>."),
  572:     [list_to_integer(N),list_to_integer(P),list_to_integer(I)].
  573: 
  574: fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node) ->
  575:     case code:is_loaded(prim_socket) of
  576:         {file,preloaded} ->
  577:             lists:sort(rpc:call(Node, socket, supports, [msg_flags]));
  578:         _ ->
  579:             ok
  580:     end.
  581: 
  582: %% ------------------------------------------------
  583: %% Just test that the system is halted here.
  584: %% The reboot facility using heart is tested
  585: %% in the heart_SUITE.
  586: %% ------------------------------------------------
  587: reboot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  588:     Args = args(),
  589:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  590:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  591:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  592:     receive
  593: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  594: 	    ok
  595:     after 10000 ->
  596: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  597: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  598:     end,
  599:     ct:sleep(5000),
  600:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  601: 	pang ->
  602: 	    ok;
  603: 	_ ->
  604: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  605: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  606:     end,
  607:     ok.
  608: 
  609: %% ------------------------------------------------
  610: %%
  611: %% ------------------------------------------------
  612: stop_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  613:     badarg = catch_stop([65,[66],67]),  % flat strings only
  614:     badarg = catch_stop([65, 666, 67]),  % only bytes in string
  615:     badarg = catch_stop(abort),  % 'abort' not allowed
  616:     badarg = catch_stop(true),  % other atoms not allowed
  617:     badarg = catch_stop(-1),  % no negative statuses
  618:     ok.
  619: 
  620: catch_stop(Status) ->
  621:     try init:stop(Status) catch error:badarg -> badarg end.
  622: 
  623: %% ------------------------------------------------
  624: %%
  625: %% ------------------------------------------------
  626: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  627:     Args = args(),
  628:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  629:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  630:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  631:     receive
  632: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  633: 	    ok
  634:     after 10000 ->
  635: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  636: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  637:     end,
  638:     ct:sleep(5000),
  639:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  640: 	pang ->
  641: 	    ok;
  642: 	_ ->
  643: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  644: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  645:     end,
  646:     ok.
  647: 
  648: %% ------------------------------------------------
  649: %% 
  650: %% ------------------------------------------------
  651: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  652:     {Start, _} = init:get_status(),
  653: 
  654:     %% Depending on how the test_server is started Start has
  655:     %% different values. staring if test_server started with
  656:     %% -s flag.
  657:     case lists:member(Start, [started, starting]) of
  658: 	true ->
  659: 	    ok;
  660: 	_ ->
  661: 	    ct:fail(get_status)
  662:     end.
  663: 
  664: %% ------------------------------------------------
  665: %% 
  666: %% ------------------------------------------------
  667: script_id(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  668:     {Name, Vsn} = init:script_id(),
  669:     if
  670: 	is_list(Name), is_list(Vsn) ->
  671: 	    ok;
  672: 	true ->
  673: 	    ct:fail(not_standard_script)
  674:     end,
  675:     ok.
  676: 
  677: %% ------------------------------------------------
  678: %% Test that .erlang file works as it should
  679: %% ------------------------------------------------
  680: dot_erlang(Config) ->
  681:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  682: 
  683:     TestHome = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  684:     ok = file:make_dir(TestHome),
  685: 
  686:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  687:                   {win32, _} ->
  688:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  689:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  690:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  691:                   _ ->
  692:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  693:               end,
  694: 
  695:     NodeOpts = #{ env => HomeEnv },
  696: 
  697:     %% Get basedir of peer node
  698:     {ok, CreatorPeer, CreatorNode} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  699:     UserConfig = erpc:call(CreatorNode, filename, basedir, [user_config,"erlang"]),
  700:     peer:stop(CreatorPeer),
  701: 
  702:     XDGErlang = filename:join([UserConfig, ".erlang"]),
  703:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(XDGErlang),
  704:     ok = file:write_file(XDGErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,xdg)."),
  705: 
  706:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  707: 
  708:     ?assertEqual({ok, xdg}, erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  709:     peer:stop(Peer),
  710: 
  711:     HomeErlang = filename:join([TestHome, ".erlang"]),
  712:     ok = file:write_file(HomeErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,home)."),
  713:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  714: 
  715:     ?assertEqual({ok, home}, erpc:call(Node2, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  716:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  717: 
  718:     ok.
  719: 
  720: unknown_module(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  721:     Port = open_port({spawn, "erl -s unknown_module"},
  722:                      [exit_status, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  723:     Error = "Error! Failed to load module 'unknown_module' because it cannot be found.",
  724:     [_ | _] = string:find(collect_until_exit_one(Port), Error),
  725:     ok.
  726: 
  727: collect_until_exit_one(Port) ->
  728:     receive
  729:         {Port, {data, Msg}} -> Msg ++ collect_until_exit_one(Port);
  730:         {Port, {exit_status, 1}} -> []
  731:     after
  732:         30_000 -> ct:fail(erl_timeout)
  733:     end.
  734: 
  735: %% ------------------------------------------------
  736: %% Start the slave system with -boot flag.
  737: %% ------------------------------------------------
  738: 
  739: boot1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  740:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", "start_sasl"],
  741:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  742:     peer:stop(Peer),
  743: 
  744:     %% Try to start with non existing boot file.
  745:     Args1 = args() ++ ["-boot", "dummy_script"],
  746:     try
  747:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args1, connection => standard_io}),
  748:         ct:fail({boot1, "started with non existing boot file"})
  749:     catch
  750:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 1}} ->
  751:             ok
  752:     end.
  753: 
  754: boot2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  755:     %% Absolute boot file name
  756:     Boot = filename:join([code:root_dir(), "bin", "start_sasl"]),
  757: 
  758:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", Boot],
  759:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  760:     peer:stop(Peer),
  761: 
  762:     case os:type() of 
  763: 	{win32, _} ->
  764: 	    %% Absolute boot file name for Windows -- all slashes are
  765: 	    %% converted to backslashes.
  766: 	    Win_boot = lists:map(fun
  767: 				     ($/) -> $\\;
  768: 				     (C) -> C
  769: 				end, Boot),
  770: 	    Args2 = args() ++ ["-boot", Win_boot],
  771: 	    {ok, Peer2, _Node2} = ?CT_PEER(Args2),
  772: 	    peer:stop(Peer2);
  773: 	_ ->
  774: 	    ok
  775:     end,
  776: 
  777:     ok.
  778: 
  779: dash_S(_Config) ->
  780: 
  781:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  782:     {[],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test([]),
  783:     {["a"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["a"]),
  784:     {["-S","--"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-S","--"]),
  785:     {["--help"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["--help"]),
  786:     {["-extra"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-extra"]),
  787:     {["-run"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-run"]),
  788:     {["-args_file"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-args_file"]),
  789:     {["+A","-1"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["+A","-1"]),
  790:     {["-s","init","stop"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  791: 
  792:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  793:     {["a"],["b","c","d"],[]} =
  794:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],["a"]),
  795:     %% test that -S in environment variables are interpreted as flags
  796:     {["a"],[],[["a"],["b"],["c"]]} =
  797:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","+S 1 -S a"},{"ERL_FLAGS","-S b"},
  798:                          {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-S c"}],["a"]),
  799: 
  800:     %% Test that -s and -run work
  801:     ?assertMatch(
  802:        "[a].{[\"a\""++_,
  803:        run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  804:     ?assertMatch(
  805:        "[\"a\"].{[\"a\""++_,
  806:        run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  807: 
  808:     %% Test error conditions
  809:     ?assertNotEqual(
  810:        nomatch,
  811:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S"]),
  812:                    "Error! The -S option must be followed by at least a module to start")),
  813: 
  814:     ?assertNotEqual(
  815:        nomatch,
  816:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S","a"]),
  817:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  818: 
  819:     ?assertNotEqual(
  820:        nomatch,
  821:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S",?MODULE,"a"]),
  822:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/1 is not exported.")),
  823: 
  824:     ok.
  825: 
  826: run_dash_S_test(Args) ->
  827:     run_dash_S_test("", Args).
  828: run_dash_S_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  829:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-S", ?MODULE, "test_dash_S" | Args]).
  830: 
  831: test_dash_S(Args) ->
  832:     AllArgs = {Args, init:get_plain_arguments(),
  833:                proplists:get_all_values('S',init:get_arguments()),
  834:                erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  835:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  836:     erlang:halt().
  837: 
  838: test_dash_s(Args) ->
  839:     io:format("~p.",[Args]).
  840: 
  841: dash_run(_Config) ->
  842: 
  843:     {undefined,[]} =
  844:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  845: 
  846:     {["a"],["b"]} =
  847:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  848: 
  849:     %% Test error conditions
  850:     ?assertNotEqual(
  851:        nomatch,
  852:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run","a"]),
  853:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  854: 
  855:     ?assertNotEqual(
  856:        nomatch,
  857:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE]),
  858:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  859: 
  860:     ?assertNotEqual(
  861:        nomatch,
  862:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"a"]),
  863:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  864: 
  865:     ok.
  866: 
  867: test_dash_run() ->
  868:     test_dash_run(undefined).
  869: test_dash_run(Args) ->
  870:     io:format("~p.",[{Args, init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)}]),
  871:     ok.
  872: 
  873: dash_s(_Config) ->
  874: 
  875:     {undefined,[]} =
  876:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  877: 
  878:     {[a],["b"]} =
  879:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  880: 
  881:     %% Test error conditions
  882:     ?assertNotEqual(
  883:        nomatch,
  884:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s","a"]),
  885:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  886: 
  887:     ?assertNotEqual(
  888:        nomatch,
  889:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE]),
  890:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  891: 
  892:     ?assertNotEqual(
  893:        nomatch,
  894:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"a"]),
  895:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  896: 
  897:     ok.
  898: 
  899: dash_extra(Config) ->
  900:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  901:     {[]} = run_dash_extra_test([]),
  902:     {["a"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["a"]),
  903:     {["--help"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["--help"]),
  904:     {["-S","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-S","--"]),
  905:     {["-extra","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-extra","--"]),
  906:     {["-run"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-run"]),
  907:     {["-args_file"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-args_file"]),
  908:     {["+A","-1"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["+A","-1"]),
  909:     {["-s","init","stop"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  910: 
  911:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  912:     {["b","c","d","a"]} =
  913:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  914:                             ["a"]),
  915:     {["c","d","+A","1","--","a"]} =
  916:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A 1 --"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  917:                             ["a"]),
  918:     {["+A","a","+B","+C"]} =
  919:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A"},
  920:                              {"ERL_FLAGS","-extra +B"},
  921:                              {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-extra +C"}],["a"]),
  922: 
  923:     %% Test that arguments from -args_file work as they should
  924:     ArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  925:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_args_file.args"),
  926:     NestedArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  927:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_nexted_args_file.args"),
  928:     file:write_file(NestedArgsFile,"y -extra +Y"),
  929: 
  930:     file:write_file(ArgsFile,["z -args_file ",NestedArgsFile," -extra +Z"]),
  931: 
  932:     {["c","z","y","d",
  933:       %% -extra starts here
  934:       "a","+Y","+Z","b"]} =
  935:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_FLAGS",["c -args_file ",ArgsFile," d -extra b"]}],["a"]),
  936: 
  937:     ok.
  938: 
  939: run_dash_extra_test(Args) ->
  940:     run_dash_extra_test([], Args).
  941: run_dash_extra_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  942:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-run", ?MODULE, "test_dash_extra", "-extra" | Args]).
  943: 
  944: test_dash_extra() ->
  945:     AllArgs = {init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  946:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  947:     erlang:halt().
  948: 
  949: 
  950: run_dash_test(Args) ->
  951:     run_dash_test([],Args).
  952: run_dash_test(Env, Args) ->
  953:     [Exec | ExecArgs] = string:split(ct:get_progname()," ", all),
  954:     PortExec = os:find_executable(Exec),
  955:     PortArgs = ExecArgs ++ ["-pa",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  956:                             "-noshell" | Args],
  957:     PortEnv = [{"ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS","0"} |
  958:                [{K,lists:flatten(V)} || {K, V} <- Env]],
  959:     ct:log("Exec: ~p~nPortArgs: ~p~nPortEnv: ~p~n",[PortExec, PortArgs, PortEnv]),
  960:     Port =
  961:         open_port({spawn_executable, PortExec},
  962:                   [stderr_to_stdout,binary,out,in,hide,exit_status,
  963:                    {args, PortArgs}, {env, PortEnv}]),
  964:     receive
  965:         {Port,{exit_status,N}} ->
  966:             N
  967:     after 5000 ->
  968:             ct:fail({timeout, receive M -> M after 0 -> [] end})
  969:     end,
  970:     Res = unicode:characters_to_list(
  971:             iolist_to_binary(
  972:               (fun F() ->
  973:                        receive
  974:                            {Port,{data,Data}} ->
  975:                                [Data | F()]
  976:                        after 0 ->
  977:                                []
  978:                        end
  979:                end)())),
  980:     ct:log("Res: ~ts~n",[Res]),
  981:     maybe
  982:         {ok, Toks, _} ?= erl_scan:string(Res),
  983:         {ok, Tuple} ?= erl_parse:parse_term(Toks),
  984:         erlang:delete_element(tuple_size(Tuple), Tuple)
  985:     else
  986:         _ ->
  987:             Res
  988:     end.
  989: 
  990: %% Misc. functions    
  991: 
  992: args() ->
  993:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp",
  994:         "--", "c", "d", "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  995: 
  996: long_args(A) ->
  997:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp", "--", "c", A,
  998:         "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  999: 
 1000: create_script(Config) ->
 1001:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1002:     Name = PrivDir ++ "boot_var_test",
 1003:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 1004:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
 1005:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
 1006:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1007:     io:format(Fd,
 1008: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1009: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
 1010: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
 1011: 	      [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1012:     file:close(Fd),
 1013:     {filename:dirname(Name), filename:basename(Name),
 1014:      KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
 1015:
